qas.question: When did Brazil pass a new Constitution?
What rights did Brasilia gain in 1988?

answers.text: to elect its Governor, and a District Assembly

qas.question: What is Brasilia's District Assembly called?
Until 1988 who was the governor of the Federal District appointed by?

plausible_answers.text: a Judicial Power of its own

qas.question: What does the Federal Government not have?
What does the Brazilian Federal Senate also serve besides the Federal District?
What does the District Assembly not have currently?

plausible_answers.text: only cases from the Federal District

qas.question: For now what kind of cases does the District Assembly serve?

context: Until the 1980s, the governor of the Federal District was appointed by <b3_0>the Federal Government<b3_0/>, and the laws of Brasília were issued by the Brazilian Federal Senate. With the Constitution of <a0_0>1988<a0_0/> Brasília gained the right <a1_0>to elect its Governor, and a District Assembly<a1_0/> (<a2_0>Câmara Legislativa<a2_0/>) was elected to exercise legislative power. The Federal District does not have <b4_0>a Judicial Power of its own<b4_0/>. The Judicial Power which serves the Federal District also serves <b5_0>federal territories<b5_0/>. Currently, Brazil does not have any <b6_0>territories<b6_0/>, therefore, for now the courts serve <b7_0>only cases from the Federal District<b7_0/>.
